title: Sigil Layout System
description:
Layout positioning system (stack and grid layouts).

Layouts define how child elements are arranged spatially. Layouts are composable - a LayoutNode can contain other LayoutNodes, enabling complex hierarchical compositions (e.g., a grid containing stacks, or stacks containing grids)

LayoutNode.description: A layout node defines how child elements are arranged spatially. Can be either a stack layout (linear arrangement) or grid layout (two-dimensional arrangement)

StackLayoutNode.description:
Linear layout that arranges children in a single row or column.

Stack layouts are simpler than grids and ideal for:
- Toolbars and navigation
- Form fields in sequence
- Card lists
- Any linear arrangement of components

Alignment works on two axes:
- Primary axis (direction of flow): controlled by spacing and flex behaviour
- Cross axis: controlled by horizontal_alignment (for vertical stacks) or vertical_alignment (for horizontal stacks)

HorizontalStackLayoutNode.description:
Horizontal stack layout - arranges children left-to-right.

Common properties:
- Size constraints work together: if only width is set, it defines the exact or preferred width. If min_width and max_width are set, they bound the width range. The final size is calculated by the rendering engine based on constraints and content

children.description: Ordered list of children to render in sequence

direction.description: Flow direction of children - fixed to 'horizontal' for this layout type

id.description: Unique identifier for this layout node

max_height.description: Maximum height - layout will not grow beyond this

max_width.description: Maximum width - layout will not grow beyond this

min_height.description: Minimum height - layout will not shrink below this

min_width.description: Minimum width - layout will not shrink below this

padding.description: Internal spacing between the layout's edges and its children

spacing.description: Space between children along the primary axis

vertical_alignment.description: How children align vertically. For horizontal stacks: aligns children vertically (top/center/bottom/fill)

VerticalStackLayoutNode.description:
Vertical stack layout - arranges children top-to-bottom.

Common properties:
- Size constraints work together: if only width is set, it defines the exact or preferred width. If min_width and max_width are set, they bound the width range. The final size is calculated by the rendering engine based on constraints and content

children.description: Ordered list of children to render in sequence

direction.description: Flow direction of children - fixed to 'vertical' for this layout type

horizontal_alignment.description: How children align horizontally. For vertical stacks: aligns children horizontally (left/center/right/fill)

id.description: Unique identifier for this layout node

max_height.description: Maximum height - layout will not grow beyond this

max_width.description: Maximum width - layout will not grow beyond this

min_height.description: Minimum height - layout will not shrink below this

min_width.description: Minimum width - layout will not shrink below this

padding.description: Internal spacing between the layout's edges and its children

spacing.description: Space between children along the primary axis

GridLayoutNode.description:
Grid layout that arranges children in rows and columns.

Grid layouts provide precise two-dimensional control and are ideal for:
- Dashboard layouts
- Form layouts with labels and inputs
- Card grids
- Any content requiring alignment on both axes

Grid supports both auto-flow (children placed automatically) and explicit positioning (using column_start/row_start on GridChild)

children.description: Children with optional positioning and spanning information

columns.description: Number of columns in the grid

id.description: Unique identifier for this layout node

max_height.description: Maximum height - layout will not grow beyond this

max_width.description: Maximum width - layout will not grow beyond this

min_height.description: Minimum height - layout will not shrink below this

min_width.description: Minimum width - layout will not shrink below this

padding.description: Internal spacing between the layout's edges and its children

rows.description: Optional number of rows. If omitted, rows are created automatically as needed (auto-flow)

GridChild.description:
A child within a grid layout with optional positioning and spanning.

Positioning modes:
- Auto-flow (default): Omit column_start and row_start - child is placed in the next available cell
- Explicit: Set column_start and row_start to place child at a specific grid position

Grid coordinates are 1-indexed (first column is 1, not 0)

column_span.description: Number of columns this child spans. Default: 1

column_start.description: Explicit column position (1-indexed). Omit to use auto-flow positioning

element.description: The layout or component to render in this grid cell

row_span.description: Number of rows this child spans. Default: 1

row_start.description: Explicit row position (1-indexed). Omit to use auto-flow positioning

LayoutChild.description:
A child element within a layout.

Can be either:
- Another layout node (enabling nested/composable layouts)
- A component (leaf node referenced by ID from ComponentSpec.components)

This discriminated union enables type-safe handling of the two cases

LayoutLayoutChild.description: Nested layout node for hierarchical composition

ComponentLayoutChild.description: Reference to a component by its ID. The component must exist in ComponentSpec.components

component_id.description: ID of the component to render
